title: Job Openings at Siemens
content:
Siemens is an Integrated Technology Company. The business activities of our Energy, Health care, Industry and Infrastructure & Cities Sectors have enabled us to capture leading market and technology positions worldwide. Technological excellence, innovation, quality, reliability and international focus have been our hallmarks for 165 years, making us strong and linking us to our shareholders, employees and customers as a partner of trust.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Field Service Engineer - Centrifugal Compressor Mechanical
     

            
    



Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job type: Full-time
Organization: Gas Services
Business Unit: Service Europe & Africa

About the Job


	This position serves as a company technical and administrative representative, resident engineer and deals with customer service assignment including on-site preventive maintenance and inspection service work, call-out services and commissioning activities on centrifugal gas compressors products line and packages.


Responsibilities
How You’ll Make An Impact:


	Understands and aligns with Siemens and customer safety policies and procedures.
	Ensure alignment with the work permit system.
	Ensure safe site and practices. Participate by attending general safety and toolbox safety meetings.
	Suggest safety improvements.
	Must be able to recognize abnormal sounds vibrations and potential safety problems at inception and take appropriate action to prevent a serious safety hazard that could develop to equipment damage or loss of production.
	Provide timely and daily reports to the relevant manager on- going projects or daily work. Stay ahead of pending work and personnel required to complete the projects. Ensure that vital parts are available and submit materials requisitions when required.
	Adequate strategy of engaging operations in releasing equipment in a timely manner for maintenance.
	Will be, required to assist in a technical manner with the operations and maintenance crew in any area if the workload exceeds the number of personnel available.
	Will apply good judgment when analyzing problems.
	Tackle problems with little or no supervision in a timely manner and at a nominal cost.
	Master all procedures and available options of identifying sources of information and technical advice.
	Will have enough product knowledge to repair and adjust minor mechanical/electrical components/systems and will be capable of reading applicable drawings and technical manuals.
	Supervise maintenance services or installation support to ensure they are carried out within company policy, manufacturers’ recommendations and in a safe manner.
	Ensure major interventions are planned, completed on time and within commercial orders. 


Requirements
What You Bring:


	Will possess a technical qualification e.g., an Engineering Degree, preferably in Mechanical Engineering.
	With 10 years of working experience in a related industry.
	Higher experience/skill levels may balance lower academic qualifications, and vice versa.
	Will have served on recognized centrifugal compressors product line and/or preferably having a long period of continuous occupation on Dresser Rand Datum compressors as a mechanical engineer.
	Experience in an onshore/offshore environment.
	A strong rotating equipment background will be an asset.
	Familiarity with gas compression theory, package systems and operation will be an asset.
	Will hold and maintain a full offshore medical and survival certificate to suit all areas of assignment.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Technical Support Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Organization: Gas Services
Business Unit: Service Europe & Africa

Responsibilities
How You’ll Make An Impact:


	Provide technical support expertise for control systems, package, electrical and mechanical issues.
	Develop work-packs and procedures for outages and projects.
	Analyze problems and provide professional guidance in resolving issues.
	Occasionally travel to provide onsite technical support.
	Ensure compliance with company and customer EHS policies.
	Provide 1st line support to field service engineers during shutdowns and projects.
	Generate the creation and preparation of work-packs for field service engineers.
	Provide 24-hour support functionality via an out-of-hours support hotline.
	Executes processes for report approvals and design changes.
	Maintain technical libraries, share-drives, and knowledge databases.
	Interact with the service engineering departments to optimize procedures.
	Multiple travels to customers and jobs sites.


Requirements
What You Bring:


	University degree in Electrical & Electronics, Electro-Mechanical, or Mechanical Engineering (2:2 minimum) or equivalent.
	Over 10 years of experience in rotating equipment and engine systems or equivalent field experience.
	Working towards or has COREN status.
	A master’s degree in engineering will be an added advantage.
	Electrical, Controls Systems and Mechanical engineering skills with over 10 years of working experience on industrial gas turbines. Packages
	Proven expertise in rotating equipment and electrical switching/control systems (HV, MV, LV).
	Proficient in MS Office tools, with strong commercial awareness and graduate-level engineering competency.
	Experienced in decision-making, strategic development, and delivering specialist tasks on time and within budget.
	Skilled in troubleshooting, developing technical policies, and generating new business opportunities.
	Effective communicator, liaising with internal and external customers, and providing technical support and training.
	Capable of diagnosing complex technical issues and coordinating various technical activities under pressure


Benefits


	Working with a global team
	Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
	Possibility to take over further tasks within the company
	Supportive work culture
	Medical benefits
	Remote/Flexible work
	Time off/Paid holidays
	Parental leave
	Continual learning through the Learn@Siemens-Energy platform
	e-Learning
	Mentorship
	Coaching.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Commercial Project Manager

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Employment type: Full-Time
Organization: SE CFO
Business Unit: Transformation of Industry

About the Team


	Our Transformation of Industry division is decarbonizing the industrial sector. Increasing electrification and  efficiency are key and demand for green H2 and derivative fuels will rise.
	We enable decarbonization of the  industrial sector and the transition to sustainable processes, building on a strong industrial customer base, a global network, diverse technologies, and integrated execution capabilities.


About the Role
A Snapshot of Your Day:


	Our Compression Service Organization is looking for a highly driven, self-motivated Commercial Expert to join our team.
	In this role, you will be responsible for all commercial aspects and project financials for Service Orders and acting as finance partner to our sales and project management organization.
	The position requires working in a dynamic environment, where financial expertise is brought to the bid, proposal, and contract execution processes.


Responsibilities
How You’ll Make an Impact:


	Review, analyze and negotiate financial and commercial components of internal/external customer proposals and Master Frame Agreements.
	Ensure the accuracy of the cost and pricing calculation during contract negotiations together with the Sales Lead & Project Manager
	Work in collaboration with the project managers to provide commercial support for assigned projects according to PM@SE guidelines and contractual agreements.
	Responsible for all commercial aspects and project financials including monthly revenue recognition, forecasting, risk and opportunity management, lessons learned, and optimizing profit margins & cash flow.
	Ensure compliance with accounting rules (IFRS 15 & local GAAP) Legal, Compliance, Tax, Foreign Exchange and business models.
	Prepare and present regular project status reports to senior management and stakeholders, highlighting progress, challenges, and solutions.
	Ability for travel when necessary/planned up to 10%; must qualify for travel within region of employment.


Requirements
What You Bring:


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, Accounting or equivalent experience is required.
	3+ years of professional experience in Business Administration or in Finance, preferably with experience in Project Execution
	Knowledge of US GAAP/IFRS, percentage of completion (PoC) accounting, and strong skills with Microsoft Office applications and SAP are required.
	Excellent communication skills with the ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment.
	Ability to multi-task and work under pressure to meet deadlines is required.


Rewards/Benefits


	Working with a global team
	Possibility of taking over further tasks within the company
	Supportive work culture
	Continual learning through the Learn@Siemens-Energy platform
	Coaching and Mentorship
	Open feedback culture

title: Job Vacancies at BIC
content:
BIC® products are known and appreciated all over the world for their quality, their affordability and ease of use. The ballpoint pen, the pocket lighter, the one-piece shaver are all part of the daily lives of millions of consumers. These products make BIC® one of the best known international brands, present in 3.2 million retail outlets, in more than 160 countries. As we explore the tremendous opportunities ahead, we have a need for dedicated and dynamic employees to help build our team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

1.) Sales Director / Head of Sales

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
Lead Business Development Function:
     

            
    




	Manage, Mentor and support national sales team to drive customer acquisition and ensure consistent volume & distribution growth
	Develop a pool of multi-skilled and high potential candidates for future expansion.
	Consistently analyze the business environment and market trends in the geography of responsibility (Nigeria) to develop the BIC brand penetration and market-share within the assigned geography.
	Sales Performance & Commercial Strategy:
	Achieve target volume and revenue goals through effective sales management and strategic account development.
	Deliver sales operational excellence in Nigeria by category, region, channel and customers through an aligned business plan
	Grow business partnership with the local distributors in the regions to find innovative and efficient ways to expand distribution for BIC products
	Identify and harness business potential and opportunities in new geographies, products, channels and customers.
	Reporting & Analytics:
	Provide regular performance reports to the General Manager, including updates on key business metrics, customer acquisition metrics and long-term growth forecasts.


Functional Role:


	Responsible for the growth of LSNL/BIC business in Nigeria
	People Development and capability building
	Develop a business plan for BIC customers in assigned geography


Main Responsibilities / Tasks


	Achieve LSNL/BIC business objective for total country; Sales Target (Volume and Value) and aligned Business Development initiatives
	Develop Business Plan for Nigeria and the Joint Business Plan (JBP) for each customer in the territory.
	JBP: regularly review with the Customers, their performance and contribution in line with Joint Business Review template.
	Develop new sales opportunities within assigned geography (Nigeria).
	Communicate business priorities to customers and ensure realization of Marketing objective in the country.
	Ensure structure and due process in the generation of sales orders and ensure prompt cash collection payment in line with AR objectives.
	Effective liaison between customers with the relevant stakeholders (Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing and Manufacturing) to guarantee volume growth and customer satisfaction.
	Create and manage a database of all customers, Traditional Trade, Corporate and Modern Trade Customers with the relevant personnel
	Ensure price and distribution compliance in the market


Market Intelligence:


	
	Regular field visits to understand and analyse local market trends for each product category (Stationery, Shavers, Lighters, and Other Products)
	
	
	Scope of the analysis: Distribution network, Customer analysis, BIC positioning, Competition analysis (price, product, distribution, promotion), Anti-counterfeiting surveillance, etc.
	


Business Development:


	Develop and support local distributors
	Train and support local sales team: product knowledge, field visit
	Respond to and follow up sales enquiries & orders
	Plan and prioritize personal sales activities and customer/prospect contact
	Lead and manage the distributor relationship with Key Accounts
	Follow up implementation of agreed marketing plans in close cooperation with BIC Marketing Manager
	In Market Sales (IMS) analysis


Key Performance Indicators:


	Achieve sales targets (volume and value)
	Number of new customers and channel execution in white spot areas
	Frequency of orders and cash collection
	Service level (speed of delivery)
	Strong Numeric and Weighted Distribution and retail coverage (plus new channels)


Requirements


	Relevant experience in sales and business development functions especially within FMCG sector
	Perfect knowledge and use of Microsoft operating system especially Power-Point & Excel
	Business and results oriented with proven communication & negotiation skills
	Proven Commercial Expertise: demonstrated ability to lead and grow business development function with a track record in customer management, relationship building and distribution expansion.
	Strong leadership capabilities with experience managing a team of sales managers, mentoring and driving team performance
	Highly adaptable with the ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, taking initiative and energizing others.
	Advanced understanding of commercial metrics and business development strategies, with experience in driving distribution & market share growth.


Click here to apply online

Note


	BIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strongly commit to hiring people with different backgrounds and experiences to help us build better products, make better decisions, and better serve our customers.
	We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or similar characteristics.
	All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.
	BIC is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity.
	Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any team member at BIC via email, or directly to a BIC team member in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the sole property of BIC, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by BIC as a result of the referral or through other means.


 

2.) Manager, Direct Procurement - Middle East and Africa

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun

Job Description


	The Sourcing Execution Manager is responsible for the implementation of the sourcing strategy and for the execution of the sourcing activities and events, as well as for smooth and compliant contracting implementation supporting the overall business and the awarding Tenders’ stage.
	The SE Manager must execute the respective sourcing activities for assigned categories in close collaboration with entire P&PE team with focus within the MEA region.
	He / She should support cost optimization for direct and indirect spend categories, sustain or improve quality and delivery, maintain or reduce risk in the supply chain.


Responsibilities


	Implement Regional sourcing execution strategy, collaborating with the supply managers team, and manage the development and accomplishment  of team KPIs
	Execute RfX, use full data, analytics and Reco for Supplier Selection to Supply Management, Develop, launch auction results , execute tendering Process (with Supplier, Business) and ensure smooth supplier on-boarding process (prior any RfX in case of new awarded suppliers)
	Identify potential suppliers, monitor, evaluate and communicate performance, develop and manage long-term supplier relationships that enhance capabilities
	Support the negotiation and implementation of supply agreements, by working with cross-functional stakeholders and suppliers to reach agreement on optimal contract terms and conditions
	Lead sourcing execution activities for assigned categories and within agreed thresholds
	Review industry leading commodity cost indicators and publications to drive competitive costing and mitigate cost associated risk in collaboration with supply management team.
	Manage communications with suppliers regarding compliance requirements and adherence to business and regulatory guidelines.
	Execute spot bids triggered by operational procurement processes in case it is required, and support is needed


Key Result Areas (KRA)


	Sourcing strategy execution
	Supply base analysis
	Supplier prequalification assessment
	Report with eRfX consolidated outcomes
	Execute light tenders


Key Performance indicators (KPI)


	Customer satisfaction improvement
	Process cycle time
	Spend via SE module in B4B (Ivalua)
	Tender process’ savings
	Automation degree
	Productivity


Stakeholders:


	Internal: Finance/ Legal & Compliance/ Supply Managers / Factory managers/ Business Partners in close collaboration
	External: Suppliers


Requirements


	Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering, Supply chain / Procurement or Business administration.
	5+ years of relevant experience in direct procurement of raw materials sourcing
	Experience in preparing tenders for direct sourcing
	Agile, ability to deal with ambiguity and complex situations
	Ability to work cross-functionally across Middle east and Africa
	Good communication skills


What do we offer


	Working for an international FMCG leader with iconic brands
	A great team of highly motivated and enthusiastic people
	Many opportunities for growth within a global organization
	Competitive salary package + corporate benefits 


Click here to apply online

Note


	BIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strongly commit to hiring people with different backgrounds and experiences to help us build better products, make better decisions, and better serve our customers.
	We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or similar characteristics.
	All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.
	BIC is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity.
	Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any team member at BIC via email, or directly to a BIC team member in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the sole property of BIC, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by BIC as a result of the referral or through other means.


 

3.) Area Sales Representative

Job Location: Jigawa

Main Responsibilities / Tasks


	Generate sales order and ensure delivery of products in the assigned sales areas and outlets
	Efficient retail redistribution of all LSNL/BIC products and effective coverage of relevant outlets in the assigned sales areas
	Regularly review of performance with the regional managers and customers in line with agreed target.
	Develop coverage Plan for the territory.
	Seek new sales opportunities within designated sales areas.
	Flawless implementation of SFA and other projects in sales areas.
	Flawless promotion execution and POSM deployment


Key Performance Indicators


	Achieving sales targets; Volume and Value
	Achieves coverage plan and number of new outlets listing
	Frequency of orders and cash collection
	Speed to shelf and high impact visibility
	Strong Numeric and Weighted Distribution of LSNL/BIC products in region.


Complex Criteria:
Professional skills:


	R - Business and results oriented with proven negotiation skills
	R - Able to identify new sales opportunities
	D - Understand needs of customers and provide solution lead
	R - Hard working, rigorous, well organized and able to work autonomously
	R - Ability to complete assigned task within a short period of time
	D - Analytic, accurate and quick interpretation of figures


Personal skills:


	R - A self-starter, working under their own initiative... and a completer/finisher
	R - Ability to analyze and provide clear recommendations
	R - Good communication skills (writing & verbal)
	R - Build strong relationships with both key external and internal customers
	R - Energy and passion for achievement of own commitments and delivering company objectives
	D - Able to influence and persuade others to take a specific course of action


Click here to apply online

Note


	BIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strongly commit to hiring people with different backgrounds and experiences to help us build better products, make better decisions, and better serve our customers.
	We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or similar characteristics. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Job Vacancies at CVM Career Company
content:
CVM Career Company (A career consulting company) - We help professionals like you use their career stories to land job interviews by writing functional CV and Resumes and we also provide them with tools to navigate the world of work through our various coaching services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Executive Assistant to the COO

Job Location: Redemption Camp, Ogun

Summary
     

            
    




	Redeemer’s Health Village is seeking a highly organized, proactive, and discreet Executive Assistant to provide direct administrative and operational support to the Chief Operating Officer (COO).
	The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, resourceful, and able to thrive in a dynamic healthcare environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the COO’s calendars, schedules, appointments, and meeting logistics.
	Draft, review, and manage reports, presentations, correspondence, and other documents on behalf of the COO.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, events, and stakeholder engagements.
	Serve as a communication link between the COO, staff, and external partners.
	Monitor project deadlines, follow-ups, and ensure smooth execution of strategic initiatives.
	Maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion in handling sensitive information.
	Provide operational support to ensure the COO’s office functions efficiently.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field.
	3–5 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant, preferably in healthcare or a fast-paced environment.
	Excellent organizational, time management, and multitasking skills.
	Strong written and verbal communication abilities.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work under pressure while managing multiple priorities.


Application Closing Date: 4th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@redeemershealthvillage.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Operations Officer

Job Locations: Lagos and Ogun
Organization: Redeemer’s Health Village (RHV)

Key Responsibilities


	Oversee day-to-day operational activities within clinical and support units.
	Monitor compliance with healthcare standards, organizational policies, and procedures.
	Coordinate logistics, procurement, and management of medical consumables and equipment.
	Work closely with clinical teams to ensure smooth patient flow and service delivery.
	Assist in data collection, analysis, and preparation of operational reports.
	Support cross-functional teams in achieving departmental and organizational goals.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Nursing, Health Administration, Operations
	2–4 years of relevant experience in healthcare operations or administration.
	Management, or a related clinical/health field.
	Strong understanding of hospital processes, patient care workflows, and resource management.
	Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office/Excel for reporting and analysis.
	Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively with clinical and non-clinical teams.


Application Closing Date: 5th September, 2025. 

Method of Application

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@redeemershealthvillage.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Pharmacist (NYSC)

Job Summary


	We are seeking a committed and enthusiastic NYSC Corps Member to serve as a Pharmacist during their service year.
	This opportunity provides hands-on experience in patient care, pharmaceutical operations, and community health programs.


Key Responsibilities


	Dispense medications and provide patient counseling

title: Job Openings at Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited
content:
Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited is an indigenous pharmaceutical company incorporated in July 1988 as a fully capitalized limited liability company with RC no 116 088 to among other activities, engage in the wholesale of Pharmaceutical products. Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited was born out of the dire need for an alternative to the hitherto existing chaotic distribution in the pharmaceutical supply chain. with the goal of addressing the gaps in the distribution value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Warehouse Support Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Warehouse support staff are responsible for the day-to-day operations of a warehouse.
	This includes receiving and storing goods, picking and packing orders, and shelving products.
	Warehouse support staff must be able to work independently and as part of a team.
	They must also be able to follow instructions and work safely in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities


	Receive, upload, and shelf supplies
	Prepare and complete orders for delivery or pickup according to schedule (load, pack, wrap, label, ship)
	Receive and process warehouse stock products (pick, unload, label, store)
	Keep a clean and safe working environment and optimize space utilization
	Report any discrepancies
	Perform stock-related duties like returning, packing, and labelling
	Inspect the delivery for discrepancies or damage
	Report damaged or short-dated inventories for record-keeping and reimbursement
	Rotate stock and dispose of surplus and expired quantities
	Communicate and cooperate with supervisors and coworkers
	Follow quality service standards and comply with procedures, rules, and regulations.


Qualification & Requirements


	Minimum of OND Qualification
	1 year of proven working experience as a Warehouse worker
	Familiarity with modern warehousing practices
	Men for gender balance
	Good stamina and the ability to lift heavy objects
	Good organisational and time management skills.
	Candidates must live close to Surulere or Ojuelegba, orenvironment with proximity. This is very important.


Salary
N110,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 25th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Warehouse Assistant

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dedicated and organized Warehouse Assistant to join our team.
	As a Warehouse assistant, you will be responsible for managing inventory, overseeing stock levels, and ensuring the smooth operation of our store.
	The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


Job Description


	Replenish supply inventories following company guidelines.
	Maintain a neat, clean, and safe working environment.
	Manage the store layout.
	Keep a record of the inventory issued.
	Receive, upload, and shelf all supplies.
	Report damaged inventories for record-keeping and reimbursement
	Rotate stock and dispose of surplus and expired quantities
	Perform stock-related duties like returning, packing, and labelling
	Inspect deliveryfor discrepancies or damage.
	Keep an organised allocation of inventory placed in the warehouse and store
	Cross-verify the monthly report at the end of each month
	Ensure proper completion of documentation to place an order and make a purchase.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a minimum of OND, HND with 1 year of work experience.
	Organized and punctual.
	Prior experience in retail would be advantageous.
	Good verbal and written communication skills.
	Physical stamina and the ability to lift and move cartons
	Proficient in Microsoft Office.
	Proximity to Ojuelegba is very important. ( Candidate residingaround Ojuelegba, Yaba, Ebute Metta, Apapa, Ajegunle, and environs ).


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 18th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Sales Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	A Pharmaceutical wholesale distributor is looking for a competitive retail Sales Assistant to help customers identify products, process customer lists, and help purchase products.
	Duties include selling, restocking, and merchandising.
	The goal is to provide high-class customer service and to increase the company’s growth and revenue through sales maximisation.


Responsibilities


	Welcome and greet customers
	Manage point-of-sale processes, picking, and invoicing
	Developing and sustaining long-lasting relationships with customers.
	Provide customers with information about products
	Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent sales service
	Developing in-depth knowledge of company products.
	Answering customers' questions and escalating complex issues to the relevant departments as needed.
	Maintaining an accurate record of all sales, customer appointments, and customer complaints.
	Ring up purchases.
	Follow all the company's policies and procedures.


Sales Assistant Requirements


	OND, HND
	Minimum of 11 year of work experience in sales,customer rep in a pharmacy or a retail store
	Computer literate.
	Excellent verbal and communication skills.
	Exceptional customer service skills.
	Proximity to Surulere, Ojuelegba, and Yaba would be most preferred.


Salary
N90,000 - N120,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 10th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
